44010047	“ No one can refuse to baptize these people with water . They have received the Holy Spirit in the same way that we did . ”
44010048	So Peter ordered that they should be baptized in the name of Jesus Christ . Then they asked Peter to stay with them for several days .
44011001	The apostles and the believers throughout Judea heard that people who were not Jewish had accepted God’s word .
44011002	However , when Peter went to Jerusalem , the believers who insisted on circumcision began to argue with him .
44011003	They said , “ You went to visit men who were uncircumcised , and you even ate with them . ”
44011004	Then Peter began to explain to them point by point what had happened . He said ,
44011005	“ I was praying in the city of Joppa when I fell into a trance . I saw something like a large linen sheet being lowered by its four corners from the sky . The sheet came near me .
44011006	I looked into the sheet very closely and saw tame animals , wild animals , reptiles , and birds .
44011007	I also heard a voice telling me , ‘ Get up , Peter ! Kill these animals , and eat them . ’
44011008	“ But I answered , ‘ I can’t do that , Lord ! I’ve never put anything impure or unclean into my mouth . ’
44011009	“ A voice spoke from heaven a second time , ‘ Don’t say that the things which God has made clean are impure . ’
44011010	This happened three times . Then everything was pulled back into the sky again .
44011011	“ At that moment three men arrived at the house where we were staying . They had been sent from Caesarea to find me .
44011012	The Spirit told me to go with them without any hesitation . Six believers from Joppa went with me , and we visited Cornelius’ home .
44011013	“ He told us that he had seen an angel standing in his home . The angel told him , ‘ Send messengers to Joppa , and summon a man whose name is Simon Peter .
44011014	He will give you a message that will save you and everyone in your home . ’
44011015	“ When I began to speak , the Holy Spirit came to these people . This was the same thing that happened to us in the beginning .
44011016	I remembered that the Lord had said , ‘ John baptized with water , but you will be baptized by the Holy Spirit . ’
44011017	When they believed , God gave them the same gift that he gave us when we believed in the Lord Jesus Christ . So who was I to interfere with God ? ”
44011018	When the others heard this , they had no further objections . They praised God by saying , “ Then God has also led people who are not Jewish to turn to him so that they can change the way they think and act and have eternal life . ”
44011019	Some of the believers who were scattered by the trouble that broke out following Stephen’s death went as far as Phoenicia , Cyprus , and the city of Antioch . They spoke God’s word only to Jewish people .
44011020	But other believers , who were from Cyprus and Cyrene , arrived in Antioch . They started to spread the Good News about the Lord Jesus to Greeks .
44011021	The Lord’s power was with his followers , and a large number of people believed and turned to the Lord .
44011022	After the news about Antioch reached the church in Jerusalem , Barnabas was sent to Antioch .
44011023	When he arrived there , he was pleased to see what God had done for them out of kindness . So he encouraged all the people to remain solidly committed to the Lord .
44011024	Barnabas was a dependable man , and he was full of the Holy Spirit and faith . A large crowd believed in the Lord .
44011025	Then Barnabas left Antioch to go to the city of Tarsus to look for Saul .
44011026	After finding Saul , Barnabas brought him back to Antioch . Barnabas and Saul met with the church in Antioch for a whole year and taught a large group of people . The disciples were called Christians for the first time in the city of Antioch .
44011027	At that time some prophets came from Jerusalem to the city of Antioch .
44011028	One of them was named Agabus . Through the Spirit Agabus predicted that a severe famine would affect the entire world . This happened while Claudius was emperor .
44011029	All the disciples in Antioch decided to contribute whatever they could afford to help the believers living in Judea .
44011030	The disciples did this and sent their contribution with Barnabas and Saul to the leaders in Jerusalem .
44012001	About that time King Herod devoted his attention to mistreating certain members of the church .
44012002	He had James , the brother of John , executed .
44012003	When he saw how this pleased the Jews , he arrested Peter too . This happened during the days of Unleavened Bread .
44012004	After capturing Peter , Herod had him thrown into prison with sixteen soldiers in squads of four to guard him . Herod wanted to bring Peter to trial in front of the people after Passover .
44012005	So Peter was kept in prison , but the church was praying very hard to God for him .
44012006	The night before Herod was going to bring Peter to trial , Peter was sleeping between two soldiers . His hands were bound with two chains , and guards were in front of the door . They were watching the prison .
44012007	Suddenly , an angel from the Lord stood near Peter , and his cell was filled with light . The angel nudged Peter’s side , woke him up , and said , “ Hurry ! Get up ! ” At that moment the chains fell from Peter’s hands .
44012008	The angel told him , “ Put your shoes on , and get ready to go ! ” Peter did this . Then the angel told him , “ Put your coat on , and follow me . ”
44012009	Peter followed the angel out of the cell . He didn’t realize that what the angel was doing was actually happening . He thought he was seeing a vision .
44012010	They passed the first and second guardposts and came to the iron gate that led into the city . This gate opened by itself for them , so they went outside and up the street . The angel suddenly left Peter .
44012011	When Peter came to his senses , he said , “ Now I’m sure that the Lord sent his angel to rescue me from Herod and from everything the Jewish people are expecting to happen to me . ”
44012012	When Peter realized what had happened , he went to the home of Mary , the mother of John Mark . Many people had gathered at her home and were praying .
44012013	Peter knocked on the door of the entryway , and a servant named Rhoda came to answer .
44012014	When she recognized Peter’s voice , she was so happy that instead of opening the door , she ran back inside and reported , “ Peter is standing at the door ! ”
44012015	The people told her , “ You’re crazy ! ” But she insisted that Peter was at the door . They said , “ It has to be his angel . ”
44012016	But Peter kept knocking . When they opened the door , they were shocked to see him .
44012017	Peter motioned with his hand to quiet them down and told them how the Lord had taken him out of prison . He added , “ Tell James and the other believers about this . ” Then he left and went somewhere else .
44012018	In the morning the soldiers were in an uproar over what had happened to Peter .
44012019	Herod searched for Peter but couldn’t find him . So he questioned the guards and gave orders to have them executed . Then Herod left Judea and went to Caesarea , where he stayed for a while .
44012020	Herod was very angry with the people of Tyre and Sidon . They were going to meet with Herod . They had agreed on what they wanted to do : They enlisted the help of Blastus to ask Herod for terms of peace . This was because their cities depended on Herod for their food supply . ( Blastus was in charge of the king’s living quarters . )
44012021	The appointed day came . Herod , wearing his royal clothes , sat on his throne and began making a speech to them .
44012022	The people started shouting , “ The voice of a god and not of a man ! ”
44012023	Immediately , an angel from the Lord killed Herod for not giving glory to God . Herod was eaten by maggots , and he died .
44012024	But God’s word continued to spread and win many followers .
44012025	After Barnabas and Saul delivered the contribution to the leaders in Jerusalem , they returned to Antioch from Jerusalem . They brought John Mark with them .
44013001	Barnabas , Simeon ( called the Black ) , Lucius ( from Cyrene ) , Manaen ( a close friend of Herod since childhood ) , and Saul were prophets and teachers in the church in Antioch .
44013002	While they were worshiping the Lord and fasting , the Holy Spirit said , “ Set Barnabas and Saul apart for me . I want them to do the work for which I called them . ”
44013003	After fasting and praying , Simeon , Lucius , and Manaen placed their hands on Barnabas and Saul , and released them from their work in Antioch .
44013004	After Barnabas and Saul were sent by the Holy Spirit , they went to the city of Seleucia and from there sailed to the island of Cyprus .
44013005	Arriving in the city of Salamis , they began to spread God’s word in the synagogues . John Mark had gone along to help them .
44013006	They went through the whole island as far as the city of Paphos . In Paphos they met a Jewish man named Barjesus . He was an astrologer who claimed to be a prophet .
44013007	He was associated with an intelligent man , Sergius Paulus , who was the governor of the island . The governor sent for Barnabas and Saul because he wanted to hear the word of God .
44013008	Elymas , whose name means , opposed them and tried to distort the meaning of the faith so that the governor wouldn’t believe .
44013009	But Saul , also known as Paul , was filled with the Holy Spirit . He stared at Elymas
44013010	and said , “ You are full of dirty tricks and schemes , you son of the devil ! You hate everything that has God’s approval . Quit trying to distort the truth about the way the Lord wants people to live .
44013011	The Lord is against you now . For a while you will be blind , unable to see the light of day . ” Suddenly , Elymas couldn’t see a thing . He tried to find people to lead him .
44013012	When the governor saw what had happened , he believed . The Lord’s teachings amazed him .
44013013	Paul and his men took a ship from Paphos and arrived in Perga , a city in Pamphylia . John Mark deserted them there and went back to Jerusalem .
44013014	Paul and Barnabas left Perga and arrived in Antioch , a city near Pisidia . On the day of worship they went into the synagogue and sat down .
44013015	After reading from Moses’ Teachings and the Prophets , the synagogue leaders sent a message to Paul and Barnabas . The message said , “ Brothers , if you have any words of encouragement for the people , feel free to speak . ”
44013016	Then Paul stood up , motioned with his hand , and said , “ Men of Israel and converts to Judaism , listen to me .
44013017	The God of the people of Israel chose our ancestors and made them a strong nation while they lived as foreigners in Egypt . He used his powerful arm to bring them out of Egypt ,
44013018	and he put up with them for about forty years in the desert .
44013019	Then he destroyed seven nations in Canaan and gave their land to his people as an inheritance .
44013020	He did all this in about four hundred and fifty years . “ After that he gave his people judges until the time of the prophet Samuel .
44013021	“ Then the people demanded a king , so God gave them Saul , son of Kish , from the tribe of Benjamin . After forty years
44013022	God removed Saul and made David their king . God spoke favorably about David . He said , ‘ I have found that David , son of Jesse , is a man after my own heart . He will do everything I want him to do . ’
44013023	“ God had the Savior , Jesus , come to Israel from David’s descendants , as he had promised .
44013024	Before Jesus began his ministry , John the Baptizer told everyone in Israel about the baptism of repentance .
44013025	When John was finishing his work , he said , ‘ Who do you think I am ? I’m not the person you’re looking for . He will come later . I’m not even good enough to untie his sandals . ’
44013026	“ Brothers—descendants of Abraham and converts to Judaism—the message that God saves people was sent to us .
44013027	The people who live in Jerusalem and their rulers didn’t know who Jesus was . They didn’t understand the prophets’ messages , which are read every day of worship . So they condemned Jesus and fulfilled what the prophets had said .
44013028	Although they couldn’t find any good reason to kill him , they asked Pilate to have him executed .
44013029	When they had finished doing everything that was written about him , they took him down from the cross and placed him in a tomb .
44013030	But God brought him back to life ,
44013031	and for many days he appeared to those who had come with him to Jerusalem from Galilee . These people are now witnesses and are testifying to the Jewish people about him .
44013032	We are telling you the Good News : What God promised our ancestors has happened .
44013033	God has fulfilled the promise for us , their descendants , by bringing Jesus back to life . This is what Scripture says in the second psalm : ‘ You are my Son . Today I have become your Father . ’
44013034	“ God stated that he brought Jesus back to life and that Jesus’ body never decayed . He said , ‘ I will give you the enduring love promised to David . ’
44013035	Another psalm says , ‘ You will not allow your holy one to decay . ’
44013036	After doing God’s will by serving the people of his time , David died . He was laid to rest with his ancestors , but his body decayed .
44013037	However , the man God brought back to life had a body that didn’t decay .
44013038	“ So , brothers , I’m telling you that through Jesus your sins can be forgiven . Sins kept you from receiving God’s approval through Moses’ Teachings .
44013039	However , everyone who believes in Jesus receives God’s approval .
44013040	“ Be careful , or what the prophets said may happen to you .
44013041	‘ Look , you mockers ! Be amazed and die ! I am going to do something in your daysthat you would not believe even if it were reported to you ! ’ ”
44013042	As Paul and Barnabas were leaving the synagogue , the people invited them to speak on the same subject the next day of worship .
44013043	When the meeting of the synagogue broke up , many Jews and converts to Judaism followed Paul and Barnabas . Paul and Barnabas talked with them and were persuading them to continue trusting God’s good will .
44013044	On the next day of worship , almost the whole city gathered to hear the Lord’s word .
44013045	When the Jews saw the crowds , they became very jealous . They used insulting language to contradict whatever Paul said .
44013046	Paul and Barnabas told them boldly , “ We had to speak the word of God to you first . Since you reject the word and consider yourselves unworthy of everlasting life , we are now going to turn to people of other nations .
44013047	The Lord gave us the following order : ‘ I have made you a light for the nationsso that you would save people all over the world . ’ ”
44013048	The people who were not Jews were pleased with what they heard and praised the Lord’s word . Everyone who had been prepared for everlasting life believed .
44013049	The word of the Lord spread throughout the whole region .
44013050	But Jews stirred up devout women of high social standing and the officials of the city . These people started to persecute Paul and Barnabas and threw them out of their territory .
44013051	In protest against these people , Paul and Barnabas shook the dust off their feet and went to the city of Iconium .
44013052	Meanwhile , the disciples in Antioch continued to be full of joy and the Holy Spirit .
44014001	The same thing happened in the city of Iconium . Paul and Barnabas went into the synagogue and spoke in such a way that a large crowd of Jews and Greeks believed .
44014002	But the Jews who refused to believe stirred up some people who were not Jewish and poisoned their minds against the believers .
44014003	Paul and Barnabas stayed in the city of Iconium for a long time . They spoke boldly about the Lord , who confirmed their message about his good will by having them perform miracles and do amazing things .
44014004	But the people of Iconium were divided . Some were for the Jews , while others were for the apostles .
44014005	In the meantime , Paul and Barnabas found out that the non-Jewish people and the Jewish people with their rulers planned to attack them and stone them to death .
44014006	So they escaped to Lystra and Derbe , cities of Lycaonia , and to the surrounding territory .
44014007	They spread the Good News there .
44014008	A man who was born lame was in Lystra . He was always sitting because he had never been able to walk .
44014009	He listened to what Paul was saying . Paul observed him closely and saw that the man believed he could be made well .
44014010	So Paul said in a loud voice , “ Stand up . ” The man jumped up and began to walk .
44014011	The crowds who saw what Paul had done shouted in the Lycaonian language , “ The gods have come to us , and they look human . ”
44014012	They addressed Barnabas as Zeus and Paul as Hermes because Paul did most of the talking .
44014013	Zeus’ temple was at the entrance to the city . The priest of the god Zeus brought bulls with flowery wreaths around their necks to the temple gates . The priest and the crowd wanted to offer a sacrifice to Paul and Barnabas .
44014014	When the apostles Barnabas and Paul heard what was happening , they were very upset . They rushed into the crowd
44014015	and said , “ Men , what are you doing ? We’re human beings like you . We’re spreading the Good News to you to turn you away from these worthless gods to the living God . The living God made the sky , the land , the sea , and everything in them .
44014016	In the past God allowed all people to live as they pleased .
44014017	Yet , by doing good , he has given evidence of his existence . He gives you rain from heaven and crops in their seasons . He fills you with food and your lives with happiness . ”
44014018	Although Paul and Barnabas said these things , they hardly kept the crowd from sacrificing to them .
44014019	However , Jews from the cities of Antioch and Iconium arrived in Lystra and won the people over . They tried to stone Paul to death and dragged him out of the city when they thought that he was dead .
44014020	But when the disciples gathered around him , he got up and went back into the city . The next day Paul and Barnabas left for the city of Derbe .
44014021	They spread the Good News in that city and won many disciples . Then they went back to the cities of Lystra , Iconium , and Antioch ( which is in Pisidia ) .
44014022	They strengthened the disciples in these cities and encouraged the disciples to remain faithful . Paul and Barnabas told them , “ We must suffer a lot to enter the kingdom of God . ”
44014023	They had the disciples in each church choose spiritual leaders , and with prayer and fasting they entrusted the leaders to the Lord in whom they believed .
44014024	After they had gone through Pisidia , they went to Pamphylia .
44014025	They spoke the message in the city of Perga and went to the city of Attalia .
44014026	From Attalia they took a boat and headed home to the city of Antioch in Syria . ( In Antioch they had been entrusted to God’s care for the work they had now finished . )
44014027	When they arrived , they called the members of the church together . They reported everything God had done through them , especially that he had given people who were not Jewish the opportunity to believe .
44014028	They stayed for a long time with these disciples .
44015001	Some men came from Judea and started to teach believers that people can’t be saved unless they are circumcised as Moses’ Teachings require .
44015002	Paul and Barnabas had a fierce dispute with these men . So Paul and Barnabas and some of the others were sent to Jerusalem to see the apostles and spiritual leaders about this claim .
44015003	The church sent Paul and Barnabas to Jerusalem . As they were going through Phoenicia and Samaria , they told the whole story of how non-Jewish people were turning to God . This story brought great joy to all the believers .
44015004	The church in Jerusalem , the apostles , and the spiritual leaders welcomed Paul and Barnabas when they arrived . Paul and Barnabas reported everything that God had done through them .
44015005	But some believers from the party of the Pharisees stood up and said , “ People who are not Jewish must be circumcised and ordered to follow Moses’ Teachings . ”
44015006	The apostles and spiritual leaders met to consider this statement .
44015007	After a lot of debating , Peter stood up and said to them , “ Brothers , you know what happened some time ago . God chose me so that people who aren’t Jewish could hear the Good News and believe .
44015008	God , who knows everyone’s thoughts , showed that he approved of people who aren’t Jewish by giving them the Holy Spirit as he gave the Holy Spirit to us .
44015009	God doesn’t discriminate between Jewish and non-Jewish people . He has cleansed non-Jewish people through faith as he has cleansed us Jews .
44015010	So why are you testing God ? You’re putting a burden on the disciples , a burden neither our ancestors nor we can carry .
44015011	We certainly believe that the Lord Jesus saves us the same way that he saves them—through his kindness . ”
44015012	The whole crowd was silent . They listened to Barnabas and Paul tell about all the miracles and amazing things that God had done through them among non-Jewish people .
44015013	After they finished speaking , James responded , “ Brothers , listen to me .
44015014	Simon has explained how God first showed his concern by taking from non-Jewish people those who would honor his name .
44015015	This agrees with what the prophets said . Scripture says ,
44015016	‘ Afterwards , I will return . I will set up David’s fallen tent again . I will restore its ruined places again . I will set it up again
44015017	so that the survivors and all the people who aren’t Jewishover whom my name is spoken , may search for the Lord , declares the Lord .
44015018	He is the one who will do these things that have always been known ! ’
44015019	“ So I’ve decided that we shouldn’t trouble non-Jewish people who are turning to God .
44015020	Instead , we should write a letter telling them to keep away from things polluted by false gods , from sexual sins , from eating the meat of strangled animals , and from eating bloody meat .
44015021	After all , Moses’ words have been spread to every city for generations . His teachings are read in synagogues on every day of worship . ”
44015022	Then the apostles , the spiritual leaders , and the whole church decided to choose some of their men to send with Paul and Barnabas to the city of Antioch . They chose Judas ( called Barsabbas ) and Silas , who were leaders among the believers .
44015023	They wrote this letter for them to deliver : From the apostles and the spiritual leaders , your brothers . To their non-Jewish brothers and sisters in Antioch , Syria , and Cilicia . Dear brothers and sisters ,
44015024	We have heard that some individuals who came from us have confused you with statements that disturb you . We did not authorize these men to speak .
44015025	So we have come to a unanimous decision that we should choose men and send them to you with our dear Barnabas and Paul .
44015026	Barnabas and Paul have dedicated their lives to our Lord , the one named Jesus Christ .
44015027	We have sent Judas and Silas to report to you on our decision .
44015028	The Holy Spirit and we have agreed not to place any additional burdens on you . Do only what is necessary
44015029	by keeping away from food sacrificed to false gods , from eating bloody meat , from eating the meat of strangled animals , and from sexual sins . If you avoid these things , you will be doing what’s right . Farewell !
44015030	So the men were sent on their way and arrived in the city of Antioch . They gathered the congregation together and delivered the letter .
44015031	When the people read the letter , they were pleased with the encouragement it brought them .
44015032	Judas and Silas , who were also prophets , spoke a long time to encourage and strengthen the believers .
44015033	After Judas and Silas had stayed in Antioch for some time , the congregation sent them back to Jerusalem with friendly greetings to those who had sent them .
44015035	Paul and Barnabas stayed in Antioch . They and many others taught people about the Lord’s word and spread the Good News .
44015036	After a while Paul said to Barnabas , “ Let’s go back to every city where we spread the Lord’s word . We’ll visit the believers to see how they’re doing . ”
44015037	Barnabas wanted to take John Mark along .
44015038	However , Paul didn’t think it was right to take a person like him along . John Mark had deserted them in Pamphylia and had not gone with them to work .
44015039	Paul and Barnabas disagreed so sharply that they parted ways . Barnabas took Mark with him and sailed to the island of Cyprus .
44015040	Paul chose Silas and left after the believers entrusted him to the Lord’s care .
44015041	Paul went through the provinces of Syria and Cilicia and strengthened the churches .
44016001	Paul arrived in the city of Derbe and then went to Lystra , where a disciple named Timothy lived . Timothy’s mother was a Jewish believer , but his father was Greek .
44016002	The believers in Lystra and Iconium spoke well of Timothy .
44016003	Paul wanted Timothy to go with him . So he circumcised him because of the Jews who lived in those places and because he knew that Timothy’s father was Greek .
44016004	As they went through the cities , they told people about the decisions that the apostles and spiritual leaders in Jerusalem had made for the people .
44016005	So the churches were strengthened in the faith and grew in numbers every day .
44016006	Paul and Silas went through the regions of Phrygia and Galatia because the Holy Spirit kept them from speaking the word in the province of Asia .
44016007	They went to the province of Mysia and tried to enter Bithynia , but the Spirit of Jesus wouldn’t allow this .
44016008	So they passed by Mysia and went to the city of Troas .
44016009	During the night Paul had a vision of a man from Macedonia . The man urged Paul , “ Come to Macedonia to help us . ”
44016010	As soon as Paul had seen the vision , we immediately looked for a way to go to Macedonia . We concluded that God had called us to tell the people of Macedonia about the Good News .
44016011	So we took a ship from Troas and sailed straight to the island of Samothrace . The next day we sailed to the city of Neapolis ,
44016012	and from there we went to the city of Philippi . Philippi is a leading city in that part of Macedonia , and it is a Roman colony . We were in this city for a number of days .
44016013	On the day of worship we went out of the city to a place along the river where we thought Jewish people gathered for prayer . We sat down and began talking to the women who had gathered there .
44016014	A woman named Lydia was present . She was a convert to Judaism from the city of Thyatira and sold purple dye for a living . She was listening because the Lord made her willing to pay attention to what Paul said .
44016015	When Lydia and her family were baptized , she invited us to stay at her home . She said , “ If you’re convinced that I believe in the Lord , then stay at my home . ” She insisted . So we did .
44016016	One day when we were going to the place of prayer , a female servant met us . She was possessed by an evil spirit that told fortunes . She made a lot of money for her owners by telling fortunes .
44016017	She used to follow Paul and shout , “ These men are servants of the Most High God . They’re telling you how you can be saved . ”
44016018	She kept doing this for many days . Paul became annoyed , turned to the evil spirit , and said , “ I command you in the name of Jesus Christ to come out of her ! ” As Paul said this , the evil spirit left her .
44016019	When her owners realized that their hope of making money was gone , they grabbed Paul and Silas and dragged them to the authorities in the public square .
44016020	In front of the Roman officials , they said , “ These men are stirring up a lot of trouble in our city . They’re Jews ,
44016021	and they’re advocating customs that we can’t accept or practice as Roman citizens . ”
44016022	The crowd joined in the attack against Paul and Silas . Then the officials tore the clothes off Paul and Silas and ordered the guards to beat them with sticks .
44016023	After they had hit Paul and Silas many times , they threw them in jail and ordered the jailer to keep them under tight security .
44016024	So the jailer followed these orders and put Paul and Silas into solitary confinement with their feet in leg irons .
44016025	Around midnight Paul and Silas were praying and singing hymns of praise to God . The other prisoners were listening to them .
44016026	Suddenly , a violent earthquake shook the foundations of the jail . All the doors immediately flew open , and all the prisoners’ chains came loose .
44016027	The jailer woke up and saw the prison doors open . Thinking the prisoners had escaped , he drew his sword and was about to kill himself .
44016028	But Paul shouted as loudly as he could , “ Don’t hurt yourself ! We’re all here ! ”
44016029	The jailer asked for torches and rushed into the jail . He was trembling as he knelt in front of Paul and Silas .
44016030	Then he took Paul and Silas outside and asked , “ Sirs , what do I have to do to be saved ? ”
44016031	They answered , “ Believe in the Lord Jesus , and you and your family will be saved . ”
44016032	They spoke the Lord’s word to the jailer and everyone in his home .
44016033	At that hour of the night , the jailer washed Paul and Silas’ wounds . The jailer and his entire family were baptized immediately .
44016034	He took Paul and Silas upstairs into his home and gave them something to eat . He and his family were thrilled to be believers in God .
44016035	In the morning the Roman officials sent guards who told the jailer , “ You can release those men now . ”
44016036	The jailer reported this order to Paul by saying , “ The officials have sent word to release you . So you can leave peacefully now . ”
44016037	But Paul told the guards , “ Roman officials have had us beaten publicly without a trial and have thrown us in jail , even though we’re Roman citizens . Now are they going to throw us out secretly ? There’s no way they’re going to get away with that ! Have them escort us out ! ”
44016038	The guards reported to the officials what Paul had said . When the Roman officials heard that Paul and Silas were Roman citizens , they were afraid .
44016039	So the officials went to the jail and apologized to Paul and Silas . As the officials escorted Paul and Silas out of the jail , they asked them to leave the city .
44016040	After Paul and Silas left the jail , they went to Lydia’s house . They met with the believers , encouraged them , and then left .
44017001	Paul and Silas traveled through the cities of Amphipolis and Apollonia and came to the city of Thessalonica , where there was a synagogue .
44017002	As usual , Paul went into the synagogue . On three consecutive days of worship , he had discussions about Scripture with the synagogue members .
44017003	He explained and showed them that the Messiah had to suffer , die , and come back to life , and that Jesus , the person he talked about , was this Messiah .
44017004	Some of the Jews were persuaded to join Paul and Silas , especially a large group of Greeks who had converted to Judaism and the wives of many prominent men .
44017005	Then the Jews became jealous . They took some low-class characters who hung around the public square , formed a mob , and started a riot in the city . They attacked Jason’s home and searched it for Paul and Silas in order to bring them out to the crowd .
44017006	When they didn’t find Paul and Silas , they dragged Jason and some other believers in front of the city officials . They shouted , “ Those men who have made trouble all over the world are now here in Thessalonica ,
44017007	and Jason has welcomed them as his guests . All of them oppose the emperor’s decrees by saying that there is another king , whose name is Jesus . ”
44017008	The crowd and the officials were upset when they heard this .
44017009	But after they had made Jason and the others post bond , they let them go .
44017010	Immediately when night came , the believers sent Paul and Silas to the city of Berea . When Paul and Silas arrived in the city of Berea , they entered the synagogue .
44017011	The people of Berea were more open-minded than the people of Thessalonica . They were very willing to receive God’s message , and every day they carefully examined the Scriptures to see if what Paul said was true .
44017012	Many of them became believers , and quite a number of them were prominent Greek men and women .
44017013	But when the Jews in Thessalonica found out that Paul was also spreading God’s word in Berea , they went there to upset and confuse the people .
44017014	The believers immediately sent Paul to the seacoast , but Silas and Timothy stayed in Berea .
44017015	The men who escorted Paul took him all the way to the city of Athens . When the men left Athens , they took instructions back to Silas and Timothy to join Paul as soon as possible .
44017016	While Paul was waiting for Silas and Timothy in Athens , he saw that the city had statues of false gods everywhere . This upset him .
44017017	He held discussions in the synagogue with Jews and converts to Judaism . He also held discussions every day in the public square with anyone who happened to be there .
44017018	Some Epicurean and Stoic philosophers had discussions with him . Some asked , “ What is this babbling fool trying to say ? ” Others said , “ He seems to be speaking about foreign gods . ” The philosophers said these things because Paul was telling the Good News about Jesus and saying that people would come back to life .
44017019	Then they brought Paul to the city court , the Areopagus , and asked , “ Could you tell us these new ideas that you’re teaching ?
44017020	Some of the things you say sound strange to us . So we would like to know what they mean . ”
44017021	Everyone who lived in Athens looked for opportunities to tell or hear something new and unusual .
44017022	Paul stood in the middle of the court and said , “ Men of Athens , I see that you are very religious .
44017023	As I was going through your city and looking closely at the objects you worship , I noticed an altar with this written on it : ‘ To an unknown god . ’ I’m telling you about the unknown god you worship .
44017024	The God who made the universe and everything in it is the Lord of heaven and earth . He doesn’t live in shrines made by humans ,
44017025	and he isn’t served by humans as if he needed anything . He gives everyone life , breath , and everything they have .
44017026	From one man he has made every nation of humanity to live all over the earth . He has given them the seasons of the year and the boundaries within which to live .
44017027	He has done this so that they would look for God , somehow reach for him , and find him . In fact , he is never far from any one of us .
44017028	Certainly , we live , move , and exist because of him . As some of your poets have said , ‘ We are God’s children . ’
44017029	So if we are God’s children , we shouldn’t think that the divine being is like an image made from gold , silver , or stone , an image that is the product of human imagination and skill .
44017030	“ God overlooked the times when people didn’t know any better . But now he commands everyone everywhere to turn to him and change the way they think and act .
44017031	He has set a day when he is going to judge the world with justice , and he will use a man he has appointed to do this . God has given proof to everyone that he will do this by bringing that man back to life . ”
44017032	When the people of the court heard that a person had come back to life , some began joking about it , while others said , “ We’ll hear you talk about this some other time . ”
44017033	With this response , Paul left the court .
44017034	Some men joined him and became believers . With them were Dionysius , who was a member of the court , and a woman named Damaris , and some other people .
44018001	After this , Paul left Athens and went to the city of Corinth .
44018002	In Corinth he met a Jewish man named Aquila and his wife Priscilla . Aquila had been born in Pontus , and they had recently come from Italy because Claudius had ordered all Jews to leave Rome . Paul went to visit them ,
44018003	and because they made tents for a living as he did , he stayed with them and they worked together .
44018004	On every day of worship , Paul would discuss Scripture in the synagogue . He tried to win over Jews and Greeks who had converted to Judaism .
44018005	But when Silas and Timothy arrived from Macedonia , Paul devoted all his time to teaching the word of God . He assured the Jews that Jesus is the Messiah .
44018006	But they opposed him and insulted him . So Paul shook the dust from his clothes and told them , “ You’re responsible for your own death . I’m innocent . From now on I’m going to people who are not Jewish . ”
44018007	Then he left the synagogue and went to the home of a man named Titius Justus , who was a convert to Judaism . His house was next door to the synagogue .
44018008	The synagogue leader Crispus and his whole family believed in the Lord . Many Corinthians who heard Paul believed and were baptized .
44018009	One night the Lord said to Paul in a vision , “ Don’t be afraid to speak out ! Don’t be silent !
44018010	I’m with you . No one will attack you or harm you . I have many people in this city . ”
44018011	Paul lived in Corinth for a year and a half and taught the word of God to them .
44018012	While Gallio was governor of Greece , the Jews had one thought in mind . They attacked Paul and brought him to court .
44018013	They said , “ This man is persuading people to worship God in ways that are against Moses’ Teachings . ”
44018014	Paul was about to answer when Gallio said to the Jews , “ If there were some kind of misdemeanor or crime involved , reason would demand that I put up with you Jews .
44018015	But since you’re disputing words , names , and your own teachings , you’ll have to take care of that yourselves . I don’t want to be a judge who gets involved in those things . ”
44018016	So Gallio had them forced out of his court .
44018017	Then all the governor’s officers took Sosthenes , the synagogue leader , and beat him in front of the court . But Gallio couldn’t have cared less .
44018018	After staying in Corinth quite a while longer , Paul left for Ephesus . Priscilla and Aquila went with him . In the city of Cenchrea , Aquila had his hair cut , since he had taken a vow . From Cenchrea they took a boat headed for Syria
44018019	and arrived in the city of Ephesus , where Paul left Priscilla and Aquila . Paul went into the synagogue and had a discussion with the Jews .
44018020	The Jews asked him to stay longer , but he refused .
44018021	As he left , he told them , “ I’ll come back to visit you if God wants me to . ” Paul took a boat from Ephesus
44018022	and arrived in the city of Caesarea . He went to Jerusalem , greeted the church , and went back to the city of Antioch .
44018023	After spending some time in Antioch , Paul went through the regions of Galatia and Phrygia , where he strengthened the faith of all the disciples .
44018024	A Jew named Apollos , who had been born in Alexandria , arrived in the city of Ephesus . He was an eloquent speaker and knew how to use the Scriptures in a powerful way .
44018025	He had been instructed in the Lord’s way and spoke enthusiastically . He accurately taught about Jesus but knew only about the baptism John performed .
44018026	He began to speak boldly in the synagogue . When Priscilla and Aquila heard him , they took him home with them and explained God’s way to him more accurately .
44018027	When Apollos wanted to travel to Greece , the believers in Ephesus encouraged him . They wrote to the disciples in Greece to tell them to welcome him . When he arrived in Greece , God’s kindness enabled him to help the believers a great deal .
44018028	In public Apollos helped them by clearly showing from the Scriptures that Jesus is the Messiah and that the Jews were wrong .
44019001	While Apollos was in Corinth , Paul traveled through the interior provinces to get to the city of Ephesus . He met some disciples in Ephesus
44019002	and asked them , “ Did you receive the Holy Spirit when you became believers ? ” They answered him , “ No , we’ve never even heard of the Holy Spirit . ”
44019003	Paul asked them , “ What kind of baptism did you have ? ” They answered , “ John’s baptism . ”
44019004	Paul said , “ John’s baptism was a baptism of repentance . John told people to believe in Jesus , who was coming later . ”
44019005	After they heard this , they were baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus .
44019006	When Paul placed his hands on them , the Holy Spirit came to them , and they began to talk in other languages and to speak what God had revealed .
44019007	About twelve men were in the group .
44019008	For three months Paul would go into the synagogue and speak boldly . He had discussions with people to convince them about the kingdom of God .
44019009	But when some people became stubborn , refused to believe , and had nothing good to say in front of the crowd about the way of Christ , he left them . He took his disciples and held daily discussions in the lecture hall of Tyrannus .
44019010	This continued for two years so that all the Jews and Greeks who lived in the province of Asia heard the word of the Lord .
44019011	God worked unusual miracles through Paul .
44019012	People would take handkerchiefs and aprons that had touched Paul’s skin to those who were sick . Their sicknesses would be cured , and evil spirits would leave them .
44019013	Some Jews used to travel from place to place and force evil spirits out of people . They tried to use the name of the Lord Jesus to force evil spirits out of those who were possessed . These Jews would say , “ I order you to come out in the name of Jesus , whom Paul talks about . ”
44019014	Seven sons of Sceva , a Jewish chief priest , were doing this .
44019015	But the evil spirit answered them , “ I know Jesus , and I’m acquainted with Paul , but who are you ? ”
44019016	Then the man possessed by the evil spirit attacked them . He beat them up so badly that they ran out of that house naked and wounded .
44019017	All the Jews and Greeks living in the city of Ephesus heard about this . All of them were filled with awe for the name of the Lord Jesus and began to speak very highly about it .
44019018	Many believers openly admitted their involvement with magical spells and told all the details .
44019019	Many of those who were involved in the occult gathered their books and burned them in front of everyone . They added up the cost of these books and found that they were worth 50,000 silver coins .
44019020	In this powerful way the word of the Lord was spreading and gaining strength .
44019021	After all these things had happened , Paul decided to go to Jerusalem by traveling through Macedonia and Greece . He said , “ After I have been there , I must see Rome . ”
44019022	So he sent two of his helpers , Timothy and Erastus , to Macedonia , while he stayed longer in the province of Asia .
44019023	During that time a serious disturbance concerning the way of Christ broke out in the city of Ephesus .
44019024	Demetrius , a silversmith , was in the business of making silver models of the temple of Artemis . His business brought a huge profit for the men who worked for him .
44019025	He called a meeting of his workers and others who did similar work . Demetrius said , “ Men , you know that we’re earning a good income from this business ,
44019026	and you see and hear what this man Paul has done . He has won over a large crowd that follows him not only in Ephesus but also throughout the province of Asia . He tells people that gods made by humans are not gods .
44019027	There’s a danger that people will discredit our line of work , and there’s a danger that people will think that the temple of the great goddess Artemis is nothing . Then she whom all Asia and the rest of the world worship will be robbed of her glory . ”
44019028	When Demetrius’ workers and the others heard this , they became furious and began shouting , “ Artemis of the Ephesians is great ! ”
44019029	The confusion spread throughout the city , and the people had one thought in mind as they rushed into the theater . They grabbed Gaius and Aristarchus , the Macedonians who traveled with Paul , and they dragged the two men into the theater with them .
44019030	Paul wanted to go into the crowd , but his disciples wouldn’t let him .
44019031	Even some officials who were from the province of Asia and who were Paul’s friends sent messengers to urge him not to risk going into the theater .
44019032	Some people shouted one thing while others shouted something else . The crowd was confused . Most of the people didn’t even know why they had come together .
44019033	Some people concluded that Alexander was the cause , so the Jews pushed him to the front . Alexander motioned with his hand to quiet the people because he wanted to defend himself in front of them .
44019034	But when they recognized that Alexander was a Jew , everyone started to shout in unison , “ Artemis of the Ephesians is great ! ” They kept doing this for about two hours .
44019035	The city clerk finally quieted the crowd . Then he said , “ Citizens of Ephesus , everyone knows that this city of the Ephesians is the keeper of the temple of the great Artemis . Everyone knows that Ephesus is the keeper of the statue that fell down from Zeus .
44019036	No one can deny this . So you have to be quiet and not do anything foolish .
44019037	The men you brought here don’t rob temples or insult our goddess .
44019038	If Demetrius and the men who work for him have a legal complaint against anyone , we have special days and officials to hold court . That’s where they should bring charges against each other .
44019039	If you want anything else , you must settle the matter in a legal assembly .
44019040	At this moment we run the risk of being accused of rioting today for no reason . We won’t be able to explain this mob . ”
44019041	After saying this , he dismissed the assembly .
44020001	When the uproar was over , Paul sent for the disciples , encouraged them , said goodbye , and left for Macedonia .
44020002	He went through that region and spoke many words of encouragement to the people . Then he went to Greece
44020003	and stayed there for three months . When Paul was going to board a ship for Syria , he found out that the Jews were plotting to kill him . So he decided to go back through Macedonia .
44020004	Sopater ( son of Pyrrhus ) from Berea , Aristarchus and Secundus from Thessalonica , Gaius from Derbe , Timothy , and Tychicus and Trophimus from the province of Asia accompanied Paul .
44020005	All these men went ahead and were waiting for us in Troas .
44020006	After the Festival of Unleavened Bread , we boarded a ship at Philippi . Five days later we joined them in Troas and stayed there for seven days .
44020007	On Sunday we met to break bread . Paul was discussing Scripture with the people . Since he intended to leave the next day , he kept talking until midnight .
44020008	( Many lamps were lit in the upstairs room where we were meeting . )
44020009	A young man named Eutychus was sitting in a window . As Paul was talking on and on , Eutychus was gradually falling asleep . Finally , overcome by sleep , he fell from the third story and was dead when they picked him up .
44020010	Paul went to him , took him into his arms , and said , “ Don’t worry ! He’s alive ! ”
44020011	Then Eutychus went upstairs again , broke the bread , and ate . Paul talked with the people for a long time , until sunrise , and then left .
44020012	The people took the boy home . They were greatly relieved that he was alive .
44020013	We went ahead to the ship and sailed for the city of Assos . At Assos , we were going to pick up Paul . He had made these arrangements , since he had planned to walk overland to Assos .
44020014	When Paul met us in Assos , we took him on board and went to the city of Mitylene .
44020015	We sailed from there . On the following day we approached the island of Chios . The next day we went by the island of Samos , and on the next day we arrived at the city of Miletus .
44020016	Paul had decided to sail past Ephesus to avoid spending time in the province of Asia . He was in a hurry to get to Jerusalem for the day of Pentecost , if that was possible .
44020017	From Miletus Paul sent messengers to the city of Ephesus and called the spiritual leaders of the church to meet with him in Miletus .
44020018	When they were with him , he said to them , “ You know how I spent all my time with you from the first day I arrived in the province of Asia .
44020019	I humbly served the Lord , often with tears in my eyes . I served the Lord during the difficult times I went through when the Jews plotted against me .
44020020	I didn’t avoid telling you anything that would help you , and I didn’t avoid teaching you publicly and from house to house .
44020021	I warned Jews and Greeks to change the way they think and act and to believe in our Lord Jesus .
44020022	“ I am determined to go to Jerusalem now . I don’t know what will happen to me there .
44020023	However , the Holy Spirit warns me in every city that imprisonment and suffering are waiting for me .
44020024	But I don’t place any value on my own life . I want to finish the race I’m running . I want to carry out the mission I received from the Lord Jesus—the mission of testifying to the Good News of God’s kindness .
44020025	“ Now I know that none of you whom I told about the kingdom of God will see me again .
44020026	Therefore , I declare to you today that I am not responsible for the spiritual death of any of you .
44020027	I didn’t avoid telling you the whole plan of God .
44020028	Pay attention to yourselves and to the entire flock in which the Holy Spirit has placed you as bishops to be shepherds for God’s church which he acquired with his own blood .
44020029	I know that fierce wolves will come to you after I leave , and they won’t spare the flock .
44020030	Some of your own men will come forward and say things that distort the truth . They will do this to lure disciples into following them .
44020031	So be alert ! Remember that I instructed each of you for three years , day and night , at times with tears in my eyes .
44020032	“ I am now entrusting you to God and to his message that tells how kind he is . That message can help you grow and can give you the inheritance that is shared by all of God’s holy people .
44020033	“ I never wanted anyone’s silver , gold , or clothes .
44020034	You know that I worked to support myself and those who were with me .
44020035	I have given you an example that by working hard like this we should help the weak . We should remember the words that the Lord Jesus said , ‘ Giving gifts is more satisfying than receiving them . ’ ”
44020036	When Paul had finished speaking , he knelt down and prayed with all of them .
44020037	Everyone cried a lot as they put their arms around Paul and kissed him .
44020038	The thought of not seeing Paul again hurt them most of all . Then they took Paul to the ship .
44021001	When we finally left them , we sailed straight to the island of Cos . The next day we sailed to the island of Rhodes and from there to the city of Patara .
44021002	In Patara , we found a ship that was going to Phoenicia , so we went aboard and sailed away .
44021003	We could see the island of Cyprus as we passed it on our left and sailed to Syria . We landed at the city of Tyre , where the ship was to unload its cargo .
44021004	In Tyre we searched for the disciples . After we found them , we stayed there for seven days . The Spirit had the disciples tell Paul not to go to Jerusalem .
44021005	When our time was up , we started on our way . All of them with their wives and children accompanied us out of the city . We knelt on the beach , prayed ,
44021006	and said goodbye to each other . Then we went aboard the ship , and the disciples went back home .
44021007	Our sea travel ended when we sailed from Tyre to the city of Ptolemais . We greeted the believers in Ptolemais and spent the day with them .
44021008	The next day we went to Philip’s home in Caesarea and stayed with him . He was a missionary and one of the seven men who helped the apostles .
44021009	Philip had four unmarried daughters who had the ability to speak what God had revealed .
44021010	After we had been there for a number of days , a prophet named Agabus arrived from Judea .
44021011	During his visit he took Paul’s belt and tied his own feet and hands with it . Then he said , “ The Holy Spirit says , ‘ This is how the Jews in Jerusalem will tie up the man who owns this belt . Then they will hand him over to people who are not Jewish . ’ ”
44021012	When we heard this , we and the believers who lived there begged Paul not to go to Jerusalem .
44021013	Then Paul replied , “ Why are you crying like this and breaking my heart ? I’m ready not only to be tied up in Jerusalem but also to die there for the sake of the Lord , the one named Jesus . ”
44021014	When Paul could not be persuaded , we dropped the issue and said , “ May the Lord’s will be done . ”
44021015	After that , we got ready to go to Jerusalem .
44021016	Some of the disciples from Caesarea went with us . They took us to Mnason’s home , where we would be staying . Mnason was from the island of Cyprus and was one of the first disciples .
44021017	When we arrived in Jerusalem , the believers welcomed us warmly .
44021018	The next day Paul went with us to visit James . All the spiritual leaders were present .
44021019	After greeting them , Paul related everything God had done through his work with non-Jewish people .
44021020	When the spiritual leaders heard about everything , they praised God . They said to Paul , “ You see , brother , how many thousands of Jews are now believers , and all of them are deeply committed to Moses’ Teachings .
44021021	But they have been told that you teach all the Jews living among non-Jewish people to abandon Moses . They claim that you tell them not to circumcise their children or follow Jewish customs .
44021022	What should we do about this ? They will certainly hear that you’re in town .
44021023	So follow our advice . We have four men who have made a vow to God .
44021024	Take these men , go through the purification ceremony with them , and pay the expenses to shave their heads . Then everyone will know that what they’ve been told about you isn’t true . Instead , they’ll see that you carefully follow Moses’ Teachings .
44021025	To clarify this matter we have written non-Jewish believers a letter with our decision . We told them that they should not eat food sacrificed to false gods , bloody meat , or the meat of strangled animals . They also should not commit sexual sins . ”
44021026	The next day , Paul took the men and went through the purification ceremony with them . Then he went into the temple courtyard to announce the time when the purification would be over and the sacrifice would be offered for each of them .
44021027	When the seven days were almost over , the Jews from the province of Asia saw Paul in the temple courtyard . They stirred up the whole crowd and grabbed Paul .
44021028	Then they began shouting , “ Men of Israel , help ! This is the man who teaches everyone everywhere to turn against the Jewish people , Moses’ Teachings , and this temple . He has even brought Greeks into the temple courtyard and has made this holy place unclean . ”
44021029	They had seen Trophimus from Ephesus with him in the city earlier and thought Paul had taken him into the temple courtyard .
44021030	The whole city was in chaos , and a mob formed . The mob grabbed Paul and dragged him out of the temple courtyard . The courtyard doors were immediately shut .
44021031	As the people were trying to kill Paul , the officer in charge of the Roman soldiers received a report that all Jerusalem was rioting .
44021032	Immediately , he took some soldiers and officers and charged the crowd . When the crowd saw the officer and the soldiers , they stopped beating Paul .
44021033	Then the officer went to Paul , grabbed him , and ordered him to be tied up with two chains . The officer asked who Paul was and what he had done .
44021034	Some of the crowd shouted one thing , while others shouted something else . The officer couldn’t get any facts because of the noise and confusion , so he ordered Paul to be taken into the barracks .
44021035	When Paul came to the stairs of the barracks , the crowd was so violent that the soldiers had to carry him .
44021036	The mob was behind them shouting , “ Kill him ! ”
44021037	As the soldiers were about to take Paul into the barracks , he asked the officer , “ May I say something to you ? ” The officer replied to Paul , “ Can you speak Greek ?
44021038	Aren’t you the Egyptian who started a revolution not long ago and led four thousand terrorists into the desert ? ”
44021039	Paul answered , “ I’m a Jew , a citizen from the well-known city of Tarsus in Cilicia . I’m asking you to let me talk to the people . ”
44021040	The officer gave Paul permission to speak . So Paul stood on the stairs of the barracks and motioned with his hand for the people to be quiet . When the mob was silent , Paul spoke to them in the Hebrew language .
44022001	“ Brothers and fathers , listen as I now present my case to you . ”
44022002	When the mob heard him speak to them in Hebrew , they became even more quiet . Then Paul continued ,
44022003	“ I’m a Jew . I was born and raised in the city of Tarsus in Cilicia and received my education from Gamaliel here in Jerusalem . My education was in the strict rules handed down by our ancestors . I was as devoted to God as all of you are today .
44022004	I persecuted people who followed the way of Christ : I tied up men and women and put them into prison until they were executed .
44022005	The chief priest and the entire council of our leaders can prove that I did this . In fact , they even gave me letters to take to the Jewish community in the city of Damascus . I was going there to tie up believers and bring them back to Jerusalem to punish them .
44022006	“ But as I was on my way and approaching the city of Damascus about noon , a bright light from heaven suddenly flashed around me .
44022007	I fell to the ground and heard a voice asking me , ‘ Saul ! Saul ! Why are you persecuting me ? ’
44022008	“ I answered , ‘ Who are you , sir ? ’ “ The person told me , ‘ I’m Jesus from Nazareth , the one you’re persecuting . ’
44022009	“ The men who were with me saw the light but didn’t understand what the person who was speaking to me said .
44022010	“ Then I asked , ‘ What do you want me to do , Lord ? ’ “ The Lord told me , ‘ Get up ! Go into the city of Damascus , and you’ll be told everything I’ve arranged for you to do . ’
44022011	“ I was blind because the light had been so bright . So the men who were with me led me into the city of Damascus .
44022012	“ A man named Ananias lived in Damascus . He was a devout person who followed Moses’ Teachings . All the Jews living in Damascus spoke highly of him .
44022013	He came to me , stood beside me , and said , ‘ Brother Saul , receive your sight ! ’ At that moment my sight came back and I could see Ananias .
44022014	“ Ananias said , ‘ The God of our ancestors has chosen you to know his will , to see the one who has God’s approval , and to hear him speak to you .
44022015	You will be his witness and will tell everyone what you have seen and heard .
44022016	What are you waiting for now ? Get up ! Be baptized , and have your sins washed away as you call on his name . ’
44022017	“ After that , I returned to Jerusalem . While I was praying in the temple courtyard , I fell into a trance
44022018	and saw the Lord . He told me , ‘ Hurry ! Get out of Jerusalem immediately . The people here won’t accept your testimony about me . ’
44022019	“ I said , ‘ Lord , people here know that I went from synagogue to synagogue to imprison and whip those who believe in you .
44022020	When Stephen , who witnessed about you , was being killed , I was standing there . I approved of his death and guarded the coats of those who were murdering him . ’
44022021	“ But the Lord told me , ‘ Go ! I’ll send you on a mission . You’ll go far away to people who aren’t Jewish . ’ ”
44022022	Up to that point the mob listened . Then they began to shout , “ Kill him ! The world doesn’t need a man like this . He shouldn’t have been allowed to live this long ! ”
44022023	The mob was yelling , taking off their coats , and throwing dirt into the air .
44022024	So the officer ordered the soldiers to take Paul into the barracks and told them to question Paul as they whipped him . The officer wanted to find out why the people were yelling at Paul like this .
44022025	But when the soldiers had Paul stretch out to tie him to the whipping post with the straps , Paul asked the sergeant who was standing there , “ Is it legal for you to whip a Roman citizen who hasn’t had a trial ? ”
44022026	When the sergeant heard this , he reported it to his commanding officer . The sergeant asked him , “ What are you doing ? This man is a Roman citizen . ”
44022027	The officer went to Paul and asked him , “ Tell me , are you a Roman citizen ? ” Paul answered , “ Yes . ”
44022028	The officer replied , “ I paid a lot of money to become a Roman citizen . ” Paul replied , “ But I was born a Roman citizen . ”
44022029	Immediately , the soldiers who were going to question Paul stepped away from him . The officer was afraid when he found out that he had tied up a Roman citizen .
44022030	The officer wanted to find out exactly what accusation the Jews had against Paul . So the officer released Paul the next day and ordered the chief priests and the entire Jewish council to meet . Then the officer brought Paul and had him stand in front of them .
44023001	Paul stared at the Jewish council and said , “ Brothers , my relationship with God has always given me a perfectly clear conscience . ”
44023002	The chief priest Ananias ordered the men standing near Paul to strike him on the mouth .
44023003	Then Paul said to him , “ God will strike you , you hypocrite ! You sit there and judge me by Moses’ Teachings and yet you break those teachings by ordering these men to strike me ! ”
44023004	The men standing near Paul said to him , “ You’re insulting God’s chief priest ! ”
44023005	Paul answered , “ Brothers , I didn’t know that he is the chief priest . After all , Scripture says , ‘ Don’t speak evil about a ruler of your people . ’ ”
44023006	When Paul saw that some of them were Sadducees and others were Pharisees , he shouted in the council , “ Brothers , I’m a Pharisee and a descendant of Pharisees . I’m on trial because I expect that the dead will come back to life . ”
44023007	After Paul said that , the Pharisees and Sadducees began to quarrel , and the men in the meeting were divided .
44023008	( The Sadducees say that the dead won’t come back to life and that angels and spirits don’t exist . The Pharisees believe in all these things . )
44023009	The shouting became very loud . Some of the scribes were Pharisees who argued their position forcefully . They said , “ We don’t find anything wrong with this man . Maybe a spirit or an angel actually spoke to him ! ”
44023010	The quarrel was becoming violent , and the officer was afraid that they would tear Paul to pieces . So the officer ordered his soldiers to drag Paul back to the barracks .
44023011	The Lord stood near Paul the next night and said to him , “ Don’t lose your courage ! You’ve told the truth about me in Jerusalem . Now you must tell the truth about me in Rome . ”
44023012	In the morning the Jews formed a conspiracy . They asked God to curse them if they ate or drank anything before they had killed Paul .
44023013	More than forty men took part in this plot .
44023014	They went to the chief priests and leaders of the people and said , “ We’ve asked God to curse us if we taste any food before we’ve killed Paul .
44023015	Here’s our plan : You and the council must go to the Roman officer on the pretext that you need more information from Paul . You have to make it look as though you want to get more accurate information about him . We’ll be ready to kill him before he gets to you . ”
44023016	But Paul’s nephew heard about the ambush . He entered the barracks and told Paul .
44023017	Then Paul called one of the sergeants and told him , “ Take this young man to the officer . He has something to tell him . ”
44023018	The sergeant took the young man to the officer and said , “ The prisoner Paul called me . He asked me to bring this young man to you because he has something to tell you . ”
44023019	The officer took the young man by the arm , went where they could be alone , and asked him , “ What do you have to tell me ? ”
44023020	The young man answered , “ The Jews have planned to ask you to bring Paul to the Jewish council tomorrow . They’re going to make it look as though they want more accurate information about him .
44023021	Don’t let them persuade you to do this . More than forty of them are planning to ambush him . They have asked God to curse them if they eat or drink anything before they have murdered him . They are ready now and are expecting you to promise that you will bring Paul . ”
44023022	The officer dismissed the young man and ordered him not to tell this information to anyone else .
44023023	Then the officer summoned two of his sergeants and told them , “ I want 200 infantrymen , 70 soldiers on horseback , and 200 soldiers with spears . Have them ready to go to Caesarea at nine o’clock tonight .
44023024	Provide an animal for Paul to ride , and take him safely to Governor Felix . ”
44023025	The officer wrote a letter to the governor with the following message :
44023026	Claudius Lysias sends greetings to Your Excellency , Governor Felix :
44023027	The Jews had seized this man and were going to murder him . When I found out that he was a Roman citizen , I went with my soldiers to rescue him .
44023028	I wanted to know what they had against him . So I took him to their Jewish council
44023029	and found their accusations had to do with disputes about Jewish teachings . He wasn’t accused of anything for which he deserved to die or to be put into prison .
44023030	Since I was informed that there was a plot against this man , I immediately sent him to you . I have also ordered his accusers to state their case against him in front of you .
44023031	So the infantrymen did as they had been ordered . They took Paul to the city of Antipatris during the night .
44023032	They returned to their barracks the next day and let the soldiers on horseback travel with Paul .
44023033	When the soldiers arrived in the city of Caesarea with Paul , they delivered the letter to the governor and handed Paul over to him .
44023034	After the governor had read the letter , he asked Paul which province he was from . When he found out that Paul was from the province of Cilicia ,
44023035	he said , “ I’ll hear your case when your accusers arrive . ” Then the governor gave orders to keep Paul under guard in Herod’s palace .
44024001	Five days later the chief priest Ananias went to the city of Caesarea with some leaders of the people and an attorney named Tertullus . They reported to the governor their charges against Paul .
44024002	When Paul had been summoned , Tertullus began to accuse him . He said to Felix , “ Your Excellency , through your wise leadership we have lasting peace and reforms that benefit the people .
44024003	We appreciate what you’ve done in every way and in every place , and we want to thank you very much .
44024004	I don’t want to keep you too long . Please listen to us . We will be brief .
44024005	We have found this man to be a troublemaker . He starts quarrels among all Jews throughout the world . He’s a ringleader of the Nazarene sect .
44024006	He also entered the temple courtyard in a way that violates our tradition . So we arrested him .
44024008	When you cross-examine him , you’ll be able to find out from him that our accusations are true . ”
44024009	The Jews supported Tertullus’ accusations and asserted that everything Tertullus said was true .
44024010	The governor motioned for Paul to speak . Paul responded , “ I know that you have been a judge over this nation for many years . So I’m pleased to present my case to you .
44024011	You can verify for yourself that I went to Jerusalem to worship no more than twelve days ago .
44024012	No one found me having a discussion with anyone in the temple courtyard or stirring up a crowd in the synagogues throughout the city .
44024013	These people cannot even prove their accusations to you .
44024014	But I’ll admit to you that I’m a follower of the way of Christ , which they call a sect . This means that I serve our ancestors’ God and believe everything written in Moses’ Teachings and the Prophets .
44024015	I hope for the same thing my accusers do , that people with God’s approval and those without it will come back to life .
44024016	With this belief I always do my best to have a clear conscience in the sight of God and people .
44024017	After many years I have come back to my people and brought gifts for the poor and offerings for God .
44024018	My accusers found me in the temple courtyard doing these things after I had gone through the purification ceremony . No crowd or noisy mob was present .
44024019	But some Jews from the province of Asia were there . They should be here in front of you to accuse me if they have anything against me .
44024020	Otherwise , these men who are accusing me should tell what I was charged with when I stood in front of their council .
44024021	They could accuse me of only one thing . As I stood among them , I shouted , ‘ I’m being tried in front of you because I believe that the dead will come back to life . ’ ”
44024022	Felix knew the way of Christ rather well , so he adjourned the trial . He told them , “ When the officer Lysias arrives , I’ll decide your case . ”
44024023	Felix ordered the sergeant to guard Paul but to let him have some freedom and to let his friends take care of his needs .
44024024	Some days later Felix arrived with his wife Drusilla , who was Jewish . He sent for Paul and listened to him talk about faith in Christ Jesus .
44024025	As Paul discussed the subjects of God’s approval , self-control , and the coming judgment , Felix became afraid and said , “ That’s enough for now . You can go . When I find time , I’ll send for you again . ”
44024026	At the same time , Felix was hoping that Paul would give him some money . For that reason , Felix would send for Paul rather often to have friendly conversations with him .
44024027	Two years passed . Then Porcius Festus took Felix’s place . ( Since Felix wanted to do the Jews a favor , he left Paul in prison . )
44025001	Three days after Festus took over his duties in the province of Judea , he went from the city of Caesarea to Jerusalem .
44025002	The chief priests and the other important Jewish leaders informed Festus about their charges against Paul . They were urging
44025003	Festus to do them the favor of having Paul brought to Jerusalem . The Jews had a plan to ambush and kill Paul as he traveled to Jerusalem .
44025004	Festus replied that he would be returning to Caesarea soon and would keep Paul there .
44025005	He told them , “ Have your authorities come to Caesarea with me and accuse him there if the man has done something wrong . ”
44025006	Festus stayed in Jerusalem for eight or ten days at the most and then returned to Caesarea . The next day Festus took his place in court and summoned Paul .
44025007	When Paul entered the room , the Jews who had come from Jerusalem surrounded him . They made a lot of serious accusations that they couldn’t prove .
44025008	Paul defended himself by saying , “ I haven’t broken any Jewish law or done anything against the temple or the emperor . ”
44025009	But Festus wanted to do the Jews a favor . So he asked Paul , “ Are you willing to go to Jerusalem to be tried there on these charges with me as your judge ? ”
44025010	Paul said , “ I am standing in the emperor’s court where I must be tried . I haven’t done anything wrong to the Jews , as you know very well .
44025011	If I am guilty and have done something wrong for which I deserve the death penalty , I don’t reject the idea of dying . But if their accusations are untrue , no one can hand me over to them as a favor . I appeal my case to the emperor ! ”
44025012	Festus discussed the appeal with his advisers and then replied to Paul , “ You have appealed your case to the emperor , so you’ll go to the emperor ! ”
44025013	Later King Agrippa and Bernice came to the city of Caesarea to welcome Festus .
44025014	Since they were staying there for a number of days , Festus told the king about Paul’s case . Festus said , “ Felix left a man here in prison .
44025015	When I went to Jerusalem , the chief priests and the Jewish leaders brought me some information about him and asked me to condemn him .
44025016	“ I replied to them , ‘ That’s not the Roman way of doing things . A person can’t be sentenced as a favor . Before he is sentenced , he must face his accusers and have a chance to defend himself against their accusation . ’
44025017	“ So the Jewish leaders came to Caesarea with me . The next day I immediately convened court and summoned the man .
44025018	When his accusers stood up , they didn’t accuse him of the crimes I was expecting .
44025019	They were disputing with him about their own religion and about some man named Jesus who had died . But Paul claimed that Jesus is alive .
44025020	Their debate about these things left me puzzled . So I asked Paul if he would like to go to Jerusalem to have his case heard there .
44025021	But Paul appealed his case . He asked to be held in prison and to have His Majesty the Emperor decide his case . So I ordered him to be held in prison until I could send him to the emperor . ”
44025022	Agrippa told Festus , “ I would like to hear the man . ” Festus replied , “ You’ll hear him tomorrow . ”
44025023	The next day Agrippa and Bernice entered the auditorium with a lot of fanfare . Roman army officers and the most important men of the city entered the auditorium with them . Festus gave the order , and Paul was brought into the auditorium .
44025024	Then Festus said , “ King Agrippa and everyone who is present with us ! All the Jews in Jerusalem and Caesarea have talked to me about this man you see in front of you . They shout that he must not be allowed to live any longer .
44025025	However , I don’t think that he has done anything to deserve the death penalty . But since he made an appeal to His Majesty the Emperor , I have decided to send him to Rome .
44025026	But I don’t have anything reliable to write our emperor about him . So I have brought him to all of you , and especially to you , King Agrippa . Then I’ll have something to write after he is cross-examined .
44025027	I find it ridiculous to send a prisoner to Rome when I can’t specify any charges against him . ”
44026001	Agrippa said to Paul , “ You’re free to speak for yourself . ” Paul acknowledged King Agrippa and then began his defense .
44026002	“ King Agrippa , I think I’m fortunate today to stand in front of you and defend myself against every charge that the Jews brought against me .
44026003	I say this since you are especially familiar with every custom and controversy in Judaism . So I ask you to listen patiently to me .
44026004	“ All the Jews know how I lived the earliest days of my youth with my own people and in Jerusalem .
44026005	They’ve known me for a long time and can testify , if they’re willing , that I followed the strictest party of our religion . They know that I lived my life as a Pharisee .
44026006	“ I’m on trial now because I expect God to keep the promise that he made to our ancestors .
44026007	Our twelve tribes expect this promise to be kept as they worship with intense devotion day and night . Your Majesty , the Jews are making accusations against me because I expect God to keep his promise .
44026008	Why do all of you refuse to believe that God can bring dead people back to life ?
44026009	“ I used to think that I had to do a lot of things to oppose the one named Jesus of Nazareth .
44026010	That is what I did in Jerusalem . By the authority I received from the chief priests , I locked many Christians in prison . I voted to have them killed every time a vote was taken .
44026011	I even went to each synagogue , punished believers , and forced them to curse the name of Jesus . In my furious rage against them , I hunted them down in cities outside Jerusalem .
44026012	“ I was carrying out these activities when I went to the city of Damascus . I had the power and authority of the chief priests .
44026013	Your Majesty , at noon , while I was traveling , I saw a light that was brighter than the sun . The light came from the sky and shined around me and those who were with me .
44026014	All of us fell to the ground , and I heard a voice asking me in Hebrew , ‘ Saul , Saul ! Why are you persecuting me ? It’s hard for a mortal like you to resist God . ’
44026015	“ I asked , ‘ Who are you , sir ? ’ “ The Lord answered , ‘ I am Jesus , the one you’re persecuting .
44026016	Stand up ! I have appeared to you for a reason . I’m appointing you to be a servant and witness of what you have seen and of what I will show you .
44026017	I will rescue you from the Jewish people and from the non-Jewish people to whom I am sending you .
44026018	You will open their eyes and turn them from darkness to light and from Satan’s control to God’s . Then they will receive forgiveness for their sins and a share among God’s people who are made holy by believing in me . ’
44026019	“ At that point I did not disobey the vision I saw from heaven , King Agrippa .
44026020	Instead , I spread the message that I first told to the Jewish people in Damascus and Jerusalem and throughout the whole country of Judea . I spread the same message to non-Jewish people . Both groups were expected to change the way they thought and acted and to turn to God . I told them to do things that prove they had changed their lives .
44026021	For this reason the Jews took me prisoner in the temple courtyard and tried to murder me .
44026022	“ God has been helping me to this day so that I can stand and testify to important and unimportant people . I tell them only what the prophets and Moses said would happen .
44026023	They said that the Messiah would suffer and be the first to come back to life and would spread light to Jewish and non-Jewish people . ”
44026024	As Paul was defending himself in this way , Festus shouted , “ Paul , you’re crazy ! Too much education is driving you crazy ! ”
44026025	Paul replied , “ I’m not crazy , Your Excellency Festus . What I’m saying is true and sane .
